newsitem.title: USA: Conyers, Ga., rejects bond issue for horse park.
newsitem.headline: Conyers, Ga., rejects bond issue for horse park.

text.p: Conyers, Ga., City Council tentatively agreed to use cash reserves and proceeds from the sale of its water system rather than issue revenue bonds to repay the loan obtained to build its Olympic horse park.

The Atlanta suburb sold the water system to surrounding Rockdale County in December for $9.9 million. It will use that money plus $3.1 million of reserves to pay the $13.3 million loan, reducing its reserves to about $1 million.
The plan was tentatively approved at a workshop Monday, and was scheduled to go before the council for a final vote Tuesday night.

City officials said avoiding debt service costs and doing maintenance in-house would put park profits at about $200,000 this year. The Georgia International Horse Park was built for the Olympics, and the city had expected revenue shortfalls during the first few years of operation.
